intro: Sanchezia arborea, commonly known as the tree sanchezia, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves that are often veined with a striking silver or white pattern. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. Sanchezia arborea is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and unique floral display.
